conclusion: Liquid flows out from points A, B, C, and D, and passes through baffles to reach containers E and F.
Point A is blue, point B is cyan, point C is yellow, and point D is green. Containers E and F are blue and yellow respectively.
There are slanted barriers (baffles) in the path of the liquid: red, purple, pink, and black.
Stream A flows straight down and splits into two branches at the black baffle.
Stream B and C strike the red slanted barrier and merge together, flowing to the left.
Stream D strikes the purple slanted barrier and is deflected to the left.

premise: Stream A splits into two branches at the black baffle.
conclusion: One branch of Stream A flows into container E.

premise: Stream B and C merge after striking the red slanted barrier.
conclusion: The merged flow of Stream B and C is deflected to the right by the black baffle.

premise: Stream D is deflected to the left by the purple slanted barrier.
conclusion: Stream D is deflected to the right by the black baffle.

premise: The merged flow of Stream B and C and Stream D are deflected to the right by the black baffle.
conclusion: Streams B, C, and D merge and flow into container F.

premise: One branch of Stream A flows into container E, and Streams B, C, and D merge and flow into container F.
conclusion: Container E receives liquid from point A, and container F receives liquid from points B, C, and D.
